Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Janice M
Reviews.Content: We went to Amsterdam for a weekend break between 23rd and 26th March 2012. We booked our accommodation at the Hotel Europa 92. Getting there from the airport was very easy and fast. We caught a taxi and only cost us 37euros total. The staff were very welcoming and helpful with whatever we asked for. The rooms and hotel were very clean with a lovely backyard that was perfect for some relaxing time. We stayed on BB and had the continental breakfast. The breakfast area was not very big but there was enough choice for everyone from the buffet - toast, cereal, orange juice, coffee machine, cheese & different types of fruits etc. The furniture in the room we had was a little outdated and might need refurbishing but the beds were extremely comfortable and spacious bathroom.The rest of the hotel was in very good condition. The hotel is situated very close to Vondelpark and many other places of interest. Thanks to the advice given by the receptionist, we enjoyed walking to the Heineken Experience, the Dam, Madame Tussauds and more. Overall, we were very pleased with everything the hotel offered, prices were reasonable and shall definitely reconsider it for or next trip there!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Scott A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Europa in December of 2011! The rates were fantastic, the room was clean, the staff were super helpful and the location was amazing! It is not a 5 star hotel but is definantly not worthy of the poor ratings it has received! There was always plenty of breakfast available - be sure to get a pot of coffee - highlight of the morning! The drinks at the bar were reasonably priced! Will most certainly stay here again when we return later in 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Correct”
Reviews.Author: superclarker
Reviews.Content: Super correct place, great location (few stops away from Centraal Station), clean, friendly staff.. Great value for money. It is not a Ritz-Carlton property but what do you expect paying less than 60 â‚¬? Highly recommendable

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: jojobead2001
Reviews.Content: The only redeeming quality about this place is the location. Other than that, the hotel was a dump. The room was the size of a walk-in closet, the bed was extremely uncomfortable, the TV was the size of my smart phone, and the odour of cigarette smoke was unforgiving. I question how "fresh" the meats and cheeses were that they put out each morning for breakfast. MOST of the hotel staff was friendly; there was, however, an older man who worked the overnight shift who was a complete jerk. He was VERY rude to us and had it happened earlier in the trip, we would have switched hotels on that incident alone. Stay somewhere else in the area if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Hole in the wall”
Reviews.Author: davuda
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a business trip. Hadn't been here before and will not be returning. Facility. The first thing I noticed was the strong smell of cigarettes that came into the reception area from the patio. The furniture, near the very small bar, had small burn holes from cigarettes. We arrived before check-in and the polite hotel staff told us to put our luggage under the open stair well and it would be fine (he was right) - but did not inspire confidence. There is a nice open air patio that is commonly used by smokers. As we checked in, we had to pay for the entire stay upfront and because we were using a credit card, had to pay a 4% surcharge. They offered a room safe - for an extra charge - that is barely big enough for a man's wallet and few other small items (smart phone)- certainly not the smallest laptop or tablet of any form. We walked up the very squeaky stairs - the hallway was very dirty and the carpets were stained. For example, the walls were scuffed, plaster walls cracked and the ceiling lamps/light bulbs in the hall way have browned/blackened the paint. Throughout our multiple day stay, there was consistent smell of smoke in the hallways that was coming from either outside or from the smoking rooms. The room was not better. The carpets were stained. We had a triple room that had 3 twin size beds. They were very soft and lumpy. One pillow/bed. There was only a bed cover, no individual sheets. The bathroom had mold on the showers. There was a generic liquid bath soap that is to be used as both shampoo and body wash. There was no clock and the lamp shade was broken. The phone had a number of missing buttons. I did like the fact that the closet locked. The floor of the room creaked loudly. The TV was 13 inches and had about 10 channels - most worked. You can pay an extra 8.5 Euros to get more channels - but you would still have to watch them on a 13 inch screen. We had a garden facing room. We had warm nights and with the lack of air conditioning, we had to leave the window open. Each night, the smell of tobacco smoke from the court yard would fill our room. The courtyard was quite after midnight - although from time to time - there would be people speaking on the phone in the courtyard that sounded like they were nearly in the room. Anyone walking in the hall would be easily heard footsteps. My best night sleep was wearing earplugs. Internet is available for 7.5 Euros for 24 hr and 1.0 Euro/hr. Went on one day to get a username/password and they said they could only offer me 1 hr for 2.5 Euros. Could not log into the internet from the room - had to go to the front desk. We came back one day to find that the room had not been cleaned. Breakfast was served each AM. It was exactly the same every day - breads (good), hams, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, cereal, coffee (had to order), orange juice. It was okay, although I stopped taking the yogurt after finding a hair in the bowel.

Reviews.Title: “aussie holiday”
Reviews.Author: rob228
Reviews.Content: The room we had booked was very smelly and dirty. Carpets were stained and the bed was lumpy with cheap pillows. The curtains were ripped, filthy dirty and stank of cigarette smoke. No soap in the shower and no tea or coffee facilities.Couldn't stand it and moved to a clean Best Western hotel around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location,”
Reviews.Author: SingerMGM
Reviews.Content: Great location close to trams within easy reach of Leidsplein on foot - walk through the Vondel Park. A very convenient clean hotel that is great value for money. Has the basic facilities you need and staff were very friendly.There was a problem with my wardrobe door and they came to fix it immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: bxyadventure
Reviews.Content: Good value in a great position with clean comfortable beds. Could improve with providing little comforts like providing tea/coffee facilities in room and a basin plug.

Reviews.Title: “Not tidy, not renovated, but good location”
Reviews.Author: travelaround1966
Reviews.Content: This little hotel with friendly staff is an adventure in itself. It seems to be built like a maze, and there are so many turns and corners that I got lost a few times. It is not very new, and there is a bit wear and tear in the whole building, so if these things bother you, choose a different place. Breakfast was fair enough. Nothing fancy, but at least it was clean in the breakfast room and staff was attentative. So, if you are ok with the fact that beds, furniture and general interior is old, this hotel is ok for the location. Probably will be looking for a different hotel for my next stay though.

Reviews.Title: “No no and no...”
Reviews.Author: Mia077
Reviews.Content: Where to start? First the positve: Friendly staff Then the negative: Shabby, old and in need for a serious upgrade / re-decoration. As the pictures show there is dirty and many thing are half broken. On our beds there were several black hair! The curtains were yellow, and our door couldnt lock, so we had to ask for assistance three times. The walls are thin, and on some levels you are allowed to smoke! This we were not told upon our booking. Although the hotel is pretty close, I would never recommend it!!!!!!! Choose insted the nh Hotels or the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jayflynn19
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is it's location, rooms of low basic standard. Wouldn't recommend it, there are better hotels in the area giving better value for money. Breakfast was also poor, tea and coffee was always served warm at best. The choice was limited. If you don't like ham and cheese then your only choice is a cereal. The garden was nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best, not great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jenfold
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Amsterdam half marathon. I guess it was clean, although hot water was intermittent - not what you need after 13 miles! We needed a triple room, which is why we went for this hotel. The triple does have 3 separate beds, which worked well for us. There was a definite hostel feel, but with hotel prices. Positives - it is close to the tram stop, only 15 minutes from Central Station. Also close to Vondelpark, which is lovely. I wouldn't stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: travelfiend_30
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a decent location (not excellent as claimed, only decent - a fast 10 min walk to Leidseplein, rather than the 3 mins they claim). This is all it has going for it. It is not a "family ran" hotel as claimed, unless it is a Turkish family that are all the same age (I have no problem with this per se, but don't claim it is a family-ran hotel). Rooms are tiny and not very clean. Phone had nothing written on any of the buttons so it was impossible to call reception. When I finally used my phone to call them (couldn't be bothered to walk down and up again), the receptionist said "why didn't you just dial *04?". Like there was any way to know that. Beds don't look great but are actually pretty comfortable and the noise level is not too high, though it does sit on a pretty main street. Staff were ok but not didn't go out of their way at all. At least they were, until they decided to give me a wake up call on my last day there at 9am, so that I will be ready to check out by 11. Like I can't set my own alarm or ask for a wake up call myself if I need one. Thanks for ruining my second night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “For Amsterdam - Good Hotel that has a decent triple”
Reviews.Author: BCollyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room that was right on the courtyard. (1) Room safe is too small for computer and you must rent key (2) No AC but with courtyard door cracked it was cool in evening for sleeping. (3) No wi-fi or internet - unless you rent 24 hour card pass (4) staff was very helpful to the point of being outstanding (5) Very safe area (6) Did not hear any noise while sleeping (7) breakfast was typical Europe - nothing fancy (8) clean room and was serviced everyday. A 10 minute walk to main area but not an unsafe or problem walk. (9) grocery store and internet cafe very near (10) #1 tram stop very near. I would stay here again depending on price.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: merseytripper
Reviews.Content: If you want a good value for money hotel with excellent breakfast with easy links to all the sights of Amsterdam, this is the place for you. Number 1 tram from Central Station goes through Leidseplein, get off at the next stop after this. Hotel is 20 yards from the tram stop. Hotel is 10 minutes walk from Museum Square. The reception staff are excellent and very helpful. Excellent choice for a short break. Suggest you get a 24, 48, 72 or 96 hour pass for all public transport within Amsterdam, easiest place to buy it is from tourist information in Schipol airport. However, you cannot use this pass to get to Amsterdam from Schipol airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 stars at all”
Reviews.Author: MNemo07
Reviews.Content: Room: . Asked for a quiet one. It was garden side, but receptionist invites friends and they talk as loud as possible until 1h30 in the morning. And close to the stairs, non isolated at all. . 30Â°C outside, but in the room (no AC), 2 non-isolated pipes continuously driving hot liquid !! . mold on the shower joints . flush working but not so well, have to try several times . mirror broken at a corner . walls to be repainted Breakfast: . The most "cheap" I've ever had in a hotel, even 1 star ones. . Coffe is absolutely disgusting BUT: . great gardenside . some of the receptionists are nice. Anyway this is far from beeing sufficient for a 120â‚¬/night 3 stars hotel. What would they offer for 2 stars, 1 star ??? Finally, I changed for the Leidse Square Hotel after my 4-day conference, and stay in Amsterdam for 4 more days. No comparison !!

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but good value”
Reviews.Author: JoanP60615
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to, and near the city center, this hotel is not fancy, but is an excellent value. My room was small, but I wasn't expecting anything else. The public rooms (lobby, bar, breakfast room) are better decorated and kept than the hallways. There is a lovely garden off the lobby bar; unfortunately, the weather while I was there didn't lend itself to sitting outside. It's an odd building, I think two thrown together, so the room numbering system is idiosyncratic and there are lots of steps up and down (which might be a problem for someone who has difficulty with stairs). But that didn't bother me; in fact, it was a running joke between me and friends who also stayed there. Breakfast is good, but not included in the room rate. This hotel has endeared itself to me by one simple act. I was in Europe when the airspace was shut down due to the volcanic activity, and my flight was cancelled. I ended up spending three extra nights in Amsterdam. I had booked into the Europa quite some time in advance, via the Internet, and so received a very low rate. They honored that for additional three nights, which they didn't have to do, and did not charge for my breakfasts those extra days. Additionally, I did not have a laptop, and they checked the flight/airport status for me, and offered to let me use the hotel's computer to check my email. Very nice, indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: misheep
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of mistake rate published on their own website. The staff there didnt admit the my reservation until I showed him Printed Screens. Horrible experience. The facilities in the room are very basic. But it's OK for me since I am a budget travel. I only need a safe, clean place to lay down my head.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the Best Value Accommodation in Amsterdam?”
Reviews.Author: White_Dragon
Reviews.Content: As we wanted to stay 7 nights in Amsterdam to cover all the sights and see a bit more of Holland, the objective was to find a city hotel, close enough to walk to the tourist sights and easy enough to get back and fore to the train station without paying a small fortune. This hotel ticked all of these boxes. Unless you want to pay Â£150 a night for a 4* then this is a very good option coming in at half that price. The flight into Schipol Airport (one of the best airports in the world) is followed by a short train journey (station underneath airport) to the Amsterdam Central Station costs â‚¬3.20 each (single) which you can buy tickets from the easy-to-use ticket machines in the airport foyer. These machines take credit cards (extra â‚¬0.50 but worth it if you haven't got a debit card that works like me) or coins only (no notes). From Amsterdam Central Station, catch the #1 tram outside the front doors to Constantijn Huygensstraat. You need small change!!! If you haven't already bought a tram ticket, board the tram at the middle doors where you buy a ticket from the conductor for â‚¬2.60 that you can use for 1 hour. These tickets have to be scanned in and out for every trip on the card sensors. I really didn't understand the tram ticket strippenkaart system (something to do with 1 strip per zone) so I decided to buy a ticket for every trip. Maybe worth asking at the hotel. They are very friendly, as everyone seemed to be in Holland. You can walk to the hotel in about 30-40 mins from the station. We arrived at the hotel around 9.30am as we had an early morning flight and had a warm welcome. Our room was available so we took the very small elevator to the second floor to room 16 which was a triple room (double and single bed) which happened to be the only double bed available. We were glad that the room was no smoking and located at the rear of the hotel. It appeared quiet and clean but not as modern as the photos on the hotel website looked. Comfortable bed and a working shower. Good enough for sleeping and washing. Nice clean towels everyday. Safe on the wall didn't work. The Ritz it is not, neither is is the Hilton or the Marriot which is a change for us. We expected it not to be and were not disappointed on the whole. From this hotel you can walk to the Museum district (Rijksmuseum & Van Gogh) in 15 minutes, the Leidseplein in 5-10 minutes. Dam Square is about a 20 minute walk through the town centre, about the same to the Anne Frank House. The best way to see the city is to hire a City Bike from Dutch Bikes around the corner (minute walk) on Overtoom (heading towards the town centre) for â‚¬10 per day (24 hours). Don't bother with the â‚¬5 insurance as the bikes have a wheel lock and a heavy duty chain and lock. Get a city map from the hotel lobby (the free Macs Bike one is the best) and cycle to the De Gooyer windmill for breakfast (best toasties in the city), and go back after 3pm for a superb beer at the Brouwerij 't IJ. You must cycle around the docks and the parks to get an overall feel to this great city. The Vondelpark has a wonderful cafe for that most needed refreshments of coffees, snacks and beers! You can burn off the calories by cycling to Westerpark. If beer tasting is one of your interests, please don't miss Gollem Bar on Raamstraat in the town centre. Google it, worth going to and buy some bottles to take home from the shop opposite! Everyone should visit the Heineken Experience, a little pricey at â‚¬15 but it's a great tour that lasts 2 hours and 3 free beers. Great for non-art lovers. They even let you pull your own beer in the bar! Other sights and visits must include the Van Gogh museum and the Anne Frank House both of which you really must buy your ticket online before you go to bypass the mile-long queues of day-trippers. The Rijksmuseum was a little disappointing for me as it's mostly closed off for renovations. I did get to see Rembrant's Night Watch though which may or may not be worth the â‚¬11 entrance fee. All depends on how much art you like. The Hansel & Gretel cafe across from the Rijksmuseum is a nice stop for lunch. The red-light district is worth a walk through. We walked through it around 4pm so it wasn't that intimidating, and although we did see drug dealers and prostitutes about, we didn't get propositioned for either services. I guess you have to visit the area as it's part of the city. If neither drugs or prostitution interests you (certainly not us!) it's not worth spending any length of time here. They do have some good fast food places though (for the munchies probably!) There's also a couple of well-placed(!) old churches in this district which are worth a visit. If you need the use of a public toilet in the city, there are very few. The best bet is to pay â‚¬0.50 in McDonalds or any bar or restaurant. It seems this is normal for the Netherlands. Don't bother paying the extortionate â‚¬7.50 an hour internet rate in the hotel, use the internet cafe on Overtoom (opp Dutch Bikes) for â‚¬1.25 per 1/2 hour. The courtyard garden of the hotel is a nice place to sit out, even if it's raining and cold, underneath the awning with the heaters on it's better than staying in the room. The TV is not worth a mention really. BBC1 Northern Ireland, CNN and Eurosport are the only english channels. Didn't want to pay â‚¬8.50 a day for 'other' channels. On a strange note - take mosquito repellant with you. Our room had quite a few. We were unprepared and paid the price getting quite a lot of bites. Must have been the time of year? Worth a train trip to Den Haag to visit Madurodam (minature village) and Delft (pottery and lovely old town). If I had to mention any negatives, the guests walking and talking loudly past our door at 1.30am & 4.30am on a Friday morning were extremely rude and inconsiderate and you can hear anyone coming up or going down the old wooden stairs at all times of day or night. Thicker carpet is needed. The mosquitos were quite annoying but I can't blame the hotel. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay more than 3 nights in Amsterdam to cut the ever-increasing costs in a safe and comfortable environment. Make good use of the discount cards in the reception and the bowl of strong mints! Thankyou to Ben (night porter) who kept me in good measures of Johnny Walker and Heineken. You are indeed a gentleman. Thankyou to the kind and hospitable day staff. Very friendly and most helpful with our week's stay in Amsterdam. We'll be back. Ian & Rachel.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Amber665
Reviews.Content: A friend and I had booked two single rooms for a week, however, when we arrived the receptionist changed and upgraded our rooms so that we could be near to each other. I had a twin room and my friend had a double, both at the front of the building so there was some noise from the trams. The trams run until 1am and start again at 5.30am, so I would recommend earplugs if you are at the front of the hotel. My room had a window very close to a neighbouring room, although there was a screen & net curtains, there was a lack of ventilation which was a bit of a problem at the start of the week when it was very hot. Our rooms had a small safe, a large locking wardrobe and hairdryers in the bathrooms. My friend's room had a small bathtub & shower, mine a large shower cubicle. Both rooms were clean and well presented and were maintained to a high standard all week. Breakfast was a choice of bread rolls with either sweet jams and preserves or savoury cheeses and meats. There was also a range of cereals, yoghurt and fruit. Teas and coffee were served as well as fruit juice or iced water. All the staff were friendly, polite and helpful, they all spoke English as well as other languages. The hotel is about 5 minutes walk away from some bars and restaurants and about 15-20 minutes walk from the city centre. Trams run from the city centre down Overtoom and stop very near the hotel. It is also convenient to visit the museums and the Vondel park.

Reviews.Title: “good for a budget hotel, but beware”
Reviews.Author: shubhB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, i found all major attractions within the city quite walkable. On the day I arrived I was allowed to check in immediately (at 9 in the morning). The elevator was barely big enough for me to squeeze in with my bag, but manageable. I found the floors and corridors of the hotel to be quite a maze though that wasn't too much of a problem either. The main problem was the room. I had a booked a double room for one night, and a triple for two. The double room i was given, had the not so picturesque view of another double room with the windows of the two rooms barely two inches apart. The lack of ventilation caused by this coupled with the lack of air conditioning made this room absolutely inhabitable (at least for me, considering it was end june and i had met a particularly hot weekend). For those interested, the room no. was 29, and presumably the room we could look into was also in the same hotel, so you might want to watch out for it as well. Besides this, at least one person in the staff(who's name i did not quite catch) was very accommodating in that he upgraded our room to a way better (which was actually very comfortable) triple on the first night itself, was helpful and friendly in marking the map and pointing things out, and (even though this is a small thing) was the only one who actually gave us a piece of toast when we asked for it, as opposed to the scandalised looks which the other staff members were gracious enough to spare.(we found out later that the hotel inflexibly does not provide toast at breakfast , which is a little strange since they do have a toaster oven at the bar a few steps away.) Anyway, they showed us a couple of their double rooms as well, and they seemed quite nice, so overall a good hotel, just need to be a bit careful while booking.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: travelrider
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a weekend trip to Amsterdam. The hotel is located within walking distance of the city center and the Van Gogh museum. The double room I stayed in was small but reasonably comfortable, although I felt that the heater could have functioned better. The bathroom was quite modern and was very decent sized for the room. However, the safe was not working properly. The hotel has a small and charming garden at the back. Breakfast was ok. There is a tram line just round the corner. If your primary purpose of visiting Amsterdam is seeing the city and spending as little time in your room as possible, then this is a decent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel, not clean. Poor value”
Reviews.Author: agrestic
Reviews.Content: The hotel was more like a cheap hostel rather than a 3-star hotel. The stair carpets were dirty. Rooms at the front are on a busy road. The seats in the lobby and the garden area were used regularly by a dog which snapped if it was approached and two parrots flew about the garden area. Our twin-bedded room was hot and the shower-room was musty smelling with the shower grout black in places. There were no toiletries only a soap dispenser (empty) over the wash-basin, no plug for the sink, no shower-mat and only one hand towel. After staying one hot and uncomfortable night in our small room and finding all local hotels of 3 or 4 star rating were full, we in desperation reserved the local 5-star Marriot Hotel for the next two nights. We suggested that, a rebate might be applicable as we were giving notice for the next 2 nights. This was not considered possible, I have no doubt that they would have been able to resell the accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “good place to just sleep with a nice inner courtyard to sit”
Reviews.Author: maimutzacelmare
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not fancy and the rooms are small but the service is excellent, the location is superb, and the cost is typical for Amsterdam. It is not a room to hang out in; it is a good place to just sleep with a nice inner courtyard to sit. The internet is exorbitant so you are better off going to an internet cafe down the street.

Reviews.Title: “dirty, noisy,run down”
Reviews.Author: EnglandNoddy
Reviews.Content: classed as a 3 star hotel, would not get AA 2 star in England, Dirty, unfreindly atmospher , holes in corrider walls, rooms not clean, on the main tram route so very noisy, breakfast is very poor quality, look for somewere else all you will be sorry, needs a complete revamp.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fabulous break”
Reviews.Author: vickiewallace
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of this hotel to say I was apprehensive towards staying here was an understatement!!!!! However when we arrived we were more than pleasently surprised!! The reception staff were extremly friendly and more than helpful. Our room although a bit on the small side was clean and well presented. The shower and toilet were also cleaned to a very high standard! Im not sure of others expectations of a 3 star hotel but this more than met ours. The hotel is in a quieter part of the city but is very close to the city centre about a 20min walk or 10 mins on the tram (no 1) There are also some very good and reasonably priced resturants in the vicinity. Overall we have had an excellent time

Reviews.Title: “Could do better....”
Reviews.Author: Pensionsman
Reviews.Content: Stayed over UK half term October holiday. Not a good start, two rooms booked next to reach other and we were initially offered on different floors. Eventually resolved. Rooms clean, loads of hot water. Double room seriously small, shower leaked. The twin room next door was much bigger and better. Public areas not kept clean. No secure luggage store which in this day and age beggars belief. Breakfast at best ok. There are much better hotels in Amsterdam and particularly in the area which has major plus points rather than closer to the city centre which is 20 minutes walk or a short tram ride, number 1.

Reviews.Title: “Stinks!!!”
Reviews.Author: countryfeedback
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a weekend in Amsterdam where we stayed at the Europa 92 hotel. When we first got in to room the window was open. Since the weather was very cold we shut the window, soon we understood why it was open. Room and the bathroom was smelling like a public WC. So windows remained open during our two days stay. There were cigarette ends under the table and they stayed there as long as we stayed there. Shower cabin was very unclean, that I won't give more detail for not being disgusting. We paid 250 Euros for two nights stay and I'm sure there were much better hotels that we could stay with this amount of money. Yes, the location is great but still, I advise anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as i imagined”
Reviews.Author: carlronstadt
Reviews.Content: reading all the reviews, i arrived expecting the worst. the first thing i would say is that wheb booking a budget hotel like this you've got to be mindful that you generally get exactly what you pay for. i arrived extremely early at 9am but the staff were superb and allocated me my room straight away. all the staff were extemely polite at all times and very helpful. i had booked a single room and assumed i would get a twin room because no hotels have single rooms these days right? no, here they have single rooms. when i entered the room i realised that cat swinging was not a national sport in holland (however every other kind of swinging is catered for in the nearby red light district). the room although small and smelling of stale cigarette smoke was spotlessly clean. as were the sheets and bathroom. bathroom had a corner shower and the usual stuff. all was good. the bed was mongst the most comfortable i have ever slept in. breakfast was sparse and i would have expected some eggs for nine euro. however, there was the usual cheeses and bread etc. sufficient to kick start the day. as for location- pretty good. far enough away from town to be out of the tourist infested rld and suchlike, but close enough to get there in one five minute tram ride. it is in a great neighbourhood close to the famous vondelspark and musuems. pay per view has the usual selection of german documentaries and porn. i even saw the same horse in a documentary and a porn film. anyways, all in all, if you arent expecting the hilton and you dont mind hearing the guy in the room next door playing the banjo in the shower then this is the place for you. cheap and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “not worth its stars”
Reviews.Author: 33spaces
Reviews.Content: the hotel is not deserving of its 3 stars. The room which we stayed in was meant to be a honeymoon suite which was shocking. The bathroon had a leaking roof not to mention the hazadous situation a guest could be faced with as the roof was leaking onto a blowdryer. Fortunatley we detected this before using the hair dryer. However if the rooms were cleaned everyday as expected from a hotel with a 3 star rating and not merely cleaned by way of a change of new towels everyday or once we had checked out after 7 days, the leaking roof would have been detected. Needless to say our rooms were situated directly next to the staff toilets which we were fortunate enough to hear flush when we occupied the room. We would not recommend spending unnecessary money on the breakfast offered by the hotel as it merely comprises of pre-packaged products which are conveniently laid out directly from the packaging. If this were a 2 star hotel the above-mentinoed would be acceptable

Reviews.Title: “Good, no frills Amsterdam hotel”
Reviews.Author: JonKMontreal_Canada
Reviews.Content: THIS IS NOT A MANAGEMENT RESPONSE: The Europa '92 is good value - I paid 80 Euros a night for a single, which included breakfast. Mostly frequented by Europeans the Europa's location is fine - not smack in the middle of the pictureque canal district but only a fifteen minute walk from it (which would account for the reasonable price). The hotel is clean (it's a clean country after all) and if you get a room "in back" then it's very quiet - which is a blessing. Friendly enough staff, internet place around the corner and some perfectly respectable restaurants in the immediate neighborhood. You can rent a bike at the friendly "dutchbikes.com" five minutes away and have a fine Amsterdam time of it. A couple of reservations about the hotel: the internet service is expensive (12 Euros for 24 hours) and not very powerful; also you can get a very very very small single if you don't watch out.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel was above expectation”
Reviews.Author: susieqt07
Reviews.Content: after reading the reviews i was a little anxious on staying here ....however from the moment we arrived we were met with friendly helpful members of staff who made us feel welcome and responded to our request of more pillows straight away . breakfast was fresh and although typically continental, there were four cereals with fresh fruit and yoguart, choice of breads or rolls with a number of meats and cheeses with spreads and jams . you also had a choice of a pot of tea or coffee . we were situated at the front of the house , and of course it would be noisy ... after all you are in the central of amsterdam !!!!! we would definatly use this hotel again and if i were to change anything , it would be to put tea making facillaties in the rooms at a small charge maybe for the deposite for the kettle .

Reviews.Title: “Just a toursit hotel”
Reviews.Author: euine
Reviews.Content: Haven't stayed at hotel myself but booked a single room so I can share general impressions. Right near hotel there is tram stop 1 that can take you to the center. Leidseplein (bars restaurants - 10 min walking) museummplein is also not too far away. Room was very small but clean. I'd say this hotel has 2,5 stars and is good if there are no very special offers in better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A what you see is what you get Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyjim
Reviews.Content: After reading the mixed reviews the hotel received we had in fact a very pleasant stay in this hotel. We booked this hotel as part of a 6 night stay package deal, so price wise I don't know what the actual cost of staying here was. We arrived on the 29th Dec and had no problems checking in, the receptionist also gave us a 5 min quick brief on the local area. We had requested a double room but on arrival we had in fact been allocated a twin room, which in hindsight was probably better given the room size, also it was at the back of the hotel facing the garden which was nice and quite apart from the noise of fireworks going off . The room itself was on the 3rd floor and if we used the lift ( which states it can take 4 people or 300kg ~ 2 people is about right ) we then had to climb down some steepish stairs to reach our room. The room itself was okay in size, the twin beds butted together , dressing table, bedside tables, 2 chairs, table and a tv ( Only CNN was in English~ extra channels at a cost) . The bathroom was on the small size, but stylish, completely tiled , and had an enclosed shower. The room was fresh and clean, the beds were comfy and fresh clean sheets and fresh towels were supplied every day, including New Years Day although i,m not sure if the rooms were cleaned. My only complaint regarding the room is that we requested extra pillows after the first night (only 1 soft pillow is allocated to each bed) only to be told that the hotel is fully booked and there is no spare pillows, we asked again every other day only to be given the same answer, i thought a hotel this size would have extra linen, pillows etc available. The Reception was open 24hrs and we found the staff to busy doing reception and other duties to be friendly,chatty but in saying that they were very helpful when asked( Except if you'e asking for pillows) . The night receptionist got to know you and had your key available for you without asking for it .The bar was next to the reception area and was covered by whoever was on reception duty, it was small, reasonable priced, just ideal for that nightcap. Breakfast was typically continental with assorted cereals, fresh breads, ham, cheese, jams etc... orange juice and hot drinks, although for some reason the tea was warm rather than hot and that was without the milk being added,and on a couple of occasions we had to ask for the meat platter to be refilled. The location of the hotel was excellant, a No 1 Tram from Central Station stopped 50 yards from the hotel in the next street ( Cost 1.60 Euro).To Leidesplein square it was 5mins max as was the designer shops which is located in Hoofenstraft . the Van Gogh and the Riksmuseum are also 10 mins from the hotel and Dam Square 15 mins walking. The only downside regarding the Europa as like any other small Amsterdam hotels is that there not really disability friendly in the number of stairs encountered and access areas. Although i,ve highlighted a few negative points this hotel is a good, clean hotel , I would not have any problem in returning to this hotel in future,or recommending it to anyone going to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased, Good Hotel ,Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MagicStar
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews we were very pleased with our stay in this hotel. We booked it on another website as it offered a reasonable price and requested a quiet room. We arrived 30th Dec at 11am and had no problems checking in so early. As requested they gave us a room overlooking the garden, so apart from the noise of fireworks going off , we had no noise at all from the traffic. The room itself was on the 4th floor (rm 27) and was indeed quite small. Basically when the door was opened, you were into the room and faced with the large bed, dressing table, bedside tables, 2 chairs and a tv. The bathroom was a good size, completely tiled ,with both a bath (ideal for soaking in, after a long day of sightseeing) and a shower. The room was fresh and clean, the bed extremely comfy and we were given fresh, soft towels everyday, including New Years Day! As I said, the room was small and would not have been suitable for a large or disabled person. The Reception was open 24hrs and we found all the staff ( and cat) to be very friendly. After the first day , we didn't need to ask for our room key as the guy would have it ready for us as soon as we walked into the hotel. Breakfast was typically Dutch with assorted cereals, fresh breads, ham, cheese, jams etc... orange juice and the usual hot drinks. The location of the hotel couldn't have been better, a short walk to the Leidesplein square, 5mins to PC Hoofenstraft ( the posh shops) and 10 mins to the museums. We got a taxi from Central Station (11 euros) but the remainder of the trip we walked everywhere. The staff organised for a taxi to take us straight to the airport to catch our early morning flight and he was there early for us. A good, clean hotel (with very comfortable beds!) and nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Pacific.1
Reviews.Content: After having read some of the reviews posted after I booked this hotel I was slightly worried but I am pleased to say that the hotel was clean and in a great location for reaching the Leidesplein (approx. 7 min walk). It is quite basic and it is not a modern hotel but this did not matter as we only wanted somewhere to sleep and spend a minmal amount of time in during the day. There is a nice garden that would be lovely in Summer time at the back of the hotel. Breakfast was included in our booking and consisted of cereal, bread, cheese and meat mainly. I was pleased with the standard of cleanliness and with the customer service that I received and it was excellent value for money. I would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid !!! -- Avoid!!! -- Avoid!!!”
Reviews.Author: rogerbrett
Reviews.Content: what a tatty little hotel - money went missing from our room safe and another couple complained money had went missing from there room as well - generally a small smelly dark hotel with unfriendly staff - all i can say is if i where you why stay there when there are nicer hotels close by where your money wont go missing and you wont have to put up with bad mannered unfriendly staff

Reviews.Title: “read the reviews before booking here”
Reviews.Author: davemathieson
Reviews.Content: we booked a vip room - dont do it room stank of damp wallpaper was falling off black mold on walls the hotel staff did not want to know one of the staff offered me an air freshener we decided not to stay and moved to another hotel close by - the owl hotel small room but very clean - the guy at europa92 insisted he was going to bill my credit card regardless so we had to phone and get the card stopped my asdvice is avoid - there are far better hotels for the same price in the same area - wish i had read the reviews here before i booked

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience at Europa 92”
Reviews.Author: dave&kath
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at Europa 92 and I must say I was very pleasantly suprised. The location was wonderful and the accomadations were extremely comfortable. The owner and his staff were very gracious hosts. I would return anytime. We particularly loved the beautiful garden with a lovely mural painted by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locaton & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: JacquieGallaghan
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a weekend in Amsterdam where we stayed at the Europa 92 hotel. After seeing some of the negative reviews on this site, I decided to write a reply. The hotel is in a fab area, only 3 mins walk to the Leidesplein area which has all of the cafes/bars and restaurants. The hotel is situated on a busy street, but it didnt disturb my sleep, and ultimately when you are in a city centre location, you have got to expect some noise. There is a nice bar area and a lovely terrace, which was great for a night cap (or two) before bedtime. Breakfast consisted of fresh bread rolls, ham, cheese, eggs etc, along with fresh orange and coffee.. absoluately no complaints about that. The staff were very friendly and helpful, in fact they couldnt have done enough for us. The rooms were basic, but clean, decent size bathrooms. My friend and I had booked two single rooms and they were more than adequate for a weekend break in the city. We paid â‚¬175 Euros each (Â£60 a night) including breakfast and city tax. The hotel was fully booked, but at no time was I disturbed or did the hotel feel noisy and cramped. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. If you want 5 star luxury stay somewhere else, but if you want a good value, friendly hotel in a great location, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Will do in a pinch, look for better prices if you have time”
Reviews.Author: LoverofLuxe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a triple bedroom (1 queen and 1 twin) for one week in June. The hotel is generally well kept with a good location. You can walk to shopping, museums and very good restaurants from here. There is a market, an ATM and internet access nearby. The room was generally neat, but as it was an older building, you never really got the sense that it was immaculate. It has many guests in it, but we rarely saw them and had the place virtually to ourselves. There was little or no noise from other guests, but we were situated at the front of the building (which we don't recommend) and heard trams and traffic all night long. The room was standard-small, the bathroom has some unknown mold growth around the vent, and our toilet seemed to be on the verge of falling off of its base. Shower only in our room. We asked for additional pillows every night and were told there were none each time. Others who asked for irons and ironing boards seemed to have difficulty bridging the language or cultural gap and asked repeatedly. Television is limited, but you can purchase several tv channels (including some not children-friendly channels) at the front desk for 7 Euros. The onsite manager is kind and efficient, other staff members were less able to address patron needs. While the website advertises a restaurant and bar, it really is not any place you would stop for more than a half hour - leaving you lots of time to discover good food through out the city! There is an elevator for those with mobility concerns. The location and a functional hotel room that is safe and secure is what you get for your dollar here; if you have time to look around I would recommend looking for something a little more luxurious for your travel dollar (see the Hotel Zandbergen or get a deal on another property). We have no real complaints but felt like we would not stay there again given the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, convenient, good staff (kind and professional)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel considering other reviews on the internet. All was perfect. The staff knows the job. The location is really near the museums and the Leidseplein (plenty of restaurants, bars, ...). The bedrooms on the street are a little noisy (trams passing in front of the hotel) but this was not terrible and we slept very well. The bedroom was clean as well as the bathroom. The breakfast is a continental one with different types of bread, cheese, cereals, marmelade, .... Everyone would find what he needs. Very nice place. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, convenient, good staff and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took the advice from a Trip Advisor review and called a week before arriving and requested a garden view room (as the street can get noisy with tram and car noise primarily). I was very happy with my garden view room and would recommend Hotel Europa '92. The room cost $90 U.S. dollars a night and for Amsterdam, it's a steal. You can come and go day and night effortlessly with a great overnight front desk person. You can get around on the trams from right outside of the hotel once you figure the tram system out. It's near a Wagamama if you are a vegetarian (like I am) and after flying for 18 hours Wagamama's fresh vegetables helped with the jetlag). Hotel Europa '92 is in walking distance to the Van Gogh museum and the Rijksmuseum. It's near the flower district, Anne Frank House, and pubs galore.

Reviews.Title: “Don't leave any valuables in your room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two nights. However, this short time was enough for someone who had access to our room to take just $40 out of the sum of $85 left in one of our suitcases. Otherwise the service was good and the room was well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a two night break at the Europa, and I have to say it was lovely. The hotel staff were very friendly, and informative of the sights to see in Amsterdam. The room we had was spotlessly clean, the only drawback being the noise from the street below, if you are a light sleeper, beware, ask for a room at the back of the hotel. The breakfast were more than adequate, with plenty of choice. Good location, and trams leave from just outside, hence the noise. Wonderful Indonesian restaurant just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Frustated!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd stay at the hotel and I'm not so sure I would stay there again. The first time went much better. This time there were a few problems, I had asked for a wake-up call the day of my flight home and got NONE and barely made my flight. While there I paid my bill in cash and when I got home I discovered they had charged my credit card $476.46, funny, my bill I paid was $365.00.....I'm glad I kept my receipt! Also, I didn't like it when the maid came in while I was taking a nap, they should have a little sign that you can hang outside the door that lets them know you don't want to be disturbed. The rooms are very small and you can hear your neighbors talking through the walls. The room I got this time was facing the street and when I opened the window (it was stuffy in there) the noise was loud to the point of not being able to hear the TV. The good points are that they have a good breakfast and their location is great!!!!! Mike

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is clean and the staff is polite. However, when you book that hotel make sure you take into account the following: The price posted on the net EXCLUDES 5% city tax 4% for credit card use 2.25â‚¬/day for the key to the safe 9â‚¬/day/person for breakfast. (Breakfast includes 3 different cereals, o-juice, fruits, cheese, rolls, sliced bread, different marmelades, etc.) So, in the end you might pay 100â‚¬ more than you thought you would. One more thing: Ask for a room facing the garden NOT the road. The road is way too busy. Nevertheless, I definitely would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at the Eurpoa 92 for 2 nights. We had room 23 which overlooked the courtyard so there was no traffic noise, it was very quiet for us except the odd selfish people that were noisy coming back to thier rooms The room had a double bed and a single in it. It only had a shower not a bath but that was adequate.Like previous comments the toilet could have done with some bleach. Breakfast was continental but I missed the luxury of toast. The staff were friendly and helpful when prompted. Locality was good, previously we had stayed at the Rho on Dam Square,on comparisson the positio of the Europa was better and for someone who gets lost chasing her own shadow I had no problem with the trams etc. and finding my way around. I would recommedn this hotel.We booked on Deckchair , for two nights and return flights we paid Â£400 all in so we felt it was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Three star”
Reviews.Author: wisbo77
Reviews.Content: Central location, close walk (10 min.) to main dining/shopping area. Tram available in front of hotel. Friendly front desk staff which is open 24hrs. Room 45 is a big room with 2 large windows, a sink, range, and fridge. Friends stayed in room 47 right next door and it was quite small with no sink, fridge or range. So if you don't like the room you were given, ask to see a different one. Room was clean and the tv offered several English speaking channels (not just CNN). Breakfast is what you expect in a european hotel, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, meats, bread, etc. The stairs leading up to the first floor are a little steep. Our room faced the front of the hotel and like a previous reviewer stated, the street noise can be quite loud. The walls are also quite thin. We paid 90 euros and I feel it was just worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was sleeping in Amsterdam Centraal Station”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, the family are reserved but nice and the courtyard is great. HOWEVER - I suggest you ask for a room at the rear. Our room overlooked the street and the noise from the trams, revellers etc was deafening. This eventually wears you down. The lavatory could also do with an extractor fan and some bleach.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out For The Safe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our European holiday started on Tues 10th June from Auckland, New Zealand. One of our stays was at Europa 92, Amsterdam for 2 nights 21st and 22nd June 2003 and have just arrived home from London. On our entire trip we kept all money on our persons. At Europa we used the safe to store our UK pounds. On arriving in London, I was UKP 60 short and my husband UKP 130 short. Whoever had access to our rooms and safe was clever enough to realise that by taking all the money, the alarm would be raised, but by just taking a portion would be unoticed! This matter will be taken up with the hotel but a positive result is not expected. Our travel insurers may also take a suspicious view but there you are.....people be alert! We are extremely careful people so this is a very large disappointment. Sue Smith and Barry Stevens

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Europa 92
HotelInfo.Address: Constantijn Huygensstraat 103 - 105, Amsterdam 1054 BV, The Netherlands
